contentrichtext.text: {{No footnotes|date=February 2008}} '''Qutaibi''' ({{lang-ar|قطيبي}} ''{{Unicode|Quṭaybī}}'') or the '''Qutaibi Sheikhdom''' (Arabic: مشيخة القطيبي ''{{Unicode|Mashyakhat al-Quṭaybī}}'') was a [[polity]] in the western [[Aden Protectorate]]. It was a dependency of the Emirate of [[Dhala]] and is now part of the Republic of [[Yemen]]. In 1964, during the [[Aden Emergency]], Qutaibi [[tribe]]smen attacked [[British Empire|British]] troops in the [[Radfan Hills]] area and became known as the "Red Wolves" for their ferocity in combat. ==External links== *[http://www.looksmartretirement.com/p/articles/mi_m0LIY/is_11_89/ai_90624108 "Tracking the 'Red Wolves of Radfan': from 1964 through 1967"] [[Category:History of Yemen]] [[Category:Former countries in the Middle East]] {{Yemen-stub}} {{MEast-hist-stub}}
